title: The Fundamentals of League
body: I was just wondering, what are the fundamentals of league? CSing is obviously one of them, but what else is there?

replies.body:
One important point I would like to share is; OBJECTIVES WIN GAMES!

At the end of a winning fight, your thoughts should be OBJECTIVES! 
Look at your team, their location, number of members, their health bar, and the mini map and judge what is the highest value objective you can secure before being under threat for the enemy.
An example of this is you may have fought at baron, and you have minions pushing past the mid point of mid lane, your best scenario would be to destroy the Inhibitor tower and the Inhibitor. 
In a slightly different case, say your minions are pushing against you, it will be more beneficial to take baron, empowered recall, and rest (push up all your) lanes. Then regroup and push down mid together with empowered minions and try to seize the tower.   

In this cases, you also need to consider the risk. 
To evaluate this you should consider how many and which enemies are still alive, and how long will it take them to get back into the fight. 
Consider whether they enemies need to recall, or if some can stay a defend without losing time. 
Also consider which enemy is alive, a healed up {{champion:7}} will be able to pick off low members of your team, whereas a {{champion:40}} will apply less kill pressure. 
Also keep in mind death timers, which change based on time in game, and whether enemies have homeguards or teleport (things that will make them come into a fight quicker). 
When enemies are unable to defend/contest an objective it is called FREE. 

So after a successful fight, balance the value of the objective, with the risk of taking it. 
Be realistic with how much time you have to secure an objective, and how much time you have till the enemy will punish. 
Make sure you take any free objectives, and communicate it with your team, so you can all work together to take objective in the most efficient manner.  

I hope I haven't overloaded you, and if you would like be to discuss some more important points I would be happy to try :).
BTW, kills are not objectives. to those who forget and lose tower chasing a low thresh

Indeed.
Towers don't respawn. Enemies do.
Towers are also generally worth more combined gold for the team.

Always have at least one tank on your team >__>

{{champion:57}}

- Trading harass.
- Knowing when to give up CS.
- Vision control. 
- Rotating for objectives. Ahh, the joys of being 5 manned bot and instead of taking 2 mid towers and top outer your team runs bot lane to scrap out a drag fight 4v5.
- NOT BEING A 1 CHAMP WONDER.

If you can pull off these *simple* things then you're OCE Diamond level.

1: intimidate your opponent, if you counter them this should be easy
2: be confident. this allows you to make plays that could potentially win lane, such as turret diving with a thresh for safety, or setting up a decent gank.
3: don't just be scared of your enemies, be scared of your allies. the team is like a chain and the weakest link is the one that always breaks first. 
   pretty clich√© thing to say really but it's true.
4: be constructive in your criticism. it can make the difference between a person afking or trying to improve and listen to your advice; example:
   "well, you did die but atleast we got the turret, don't worry about it"
5: check over your champion before you enter the lobby, have a selection of champions you play that;
    A) all benefit from the same 2 or more rune pages
    B) all have an established and tested mastery page
    C) all have been prepared with an item set.

    this will equip you to be able to take down certain targets.

6: don't blame yourself if you are countered. 
    if you know you are countered then don't feel bad for it. its nothing you can really do.

7: make appropriate decisions based on your situation. this means know when to push, when to pull and when to try and help other lanes or junglers with buffs. it also includes appropriate builds to counter the heavy damage members of the enemy team, consider replacing your blood thirster with a dervish blade or something similar as an example.

8: the most important one; enjoy the game. it's just a game. if you lose, don't scream at your team mates, don't report everyone in both teams, don't call your team mates names and insult them as you start on a downward slope.
because after that match you can always get up, take a walk, have a beer, do something you enjoy.
